title: 103_s943
content: The Act is titled the "Children's Television Violence Protection Act of 1993" and includes definitions. The Act defines terms such as "violence" as physical force with intent to cause harm, "programming" to include cartoons, "child" as individuals under 18, "person" as defined in the Communications Act of 1934, and "cable operator" with the same meaning. The term "cable operator" is defined under section 602(4) of the Communications Act of 1934. The term "cable service" is defined under section 602(5) of the same Act. A "television broadcast licensee" is authorized to engage in television broadcasting. The term "franchising authority" is defined under section 602(10) of the Communications Act of 1934. SEC. 3. RULEMAKING REQUIRED. The Federal Communications Commission must establish standards for television broadcast licensees and cable operators regarding the broadcasting of violent or unsafe gun content, requiring a warning about potential harm to children's mental or physical health. The FCC must establish standards for TV broadcast licensees and cable operators to include warnings about violence and unsafe gun practices in programming that may harm children's mental or physical health. Public notice should also be provided to help viewers identify potentially harmful content. The FCC will establish standards for TV broadcast licensees and cable operators to include warnings about violence and unsafe gun practices in programming. There is an exception for programming broadcast between 11:00 P.M. and 6:00 A.M. SEC. 4 outlines fines for violations of FCC rules, with a maximum fine of $5,000 for non-intentional violations and a minimum fine of $10,000 for intentional violations. Each day of violation is considered a separate offense. The Federal Communications Commission may exempt certain video programming, such as news broadcasts and documentaries, from certain requirements. The FCC will consider compliance with standards under section 3 when reviewing applications for television broadcast license renewal.
